message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We use two datasets in this study: a dataset on electricity consumption for households and the World Bank's Development Indicators dataset.", "dataset": ["electricity consumption for households", "World Bank's Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Energy", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws on data from nationally-representative surveys conducted by the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) program to investigate the relationship between maternal health outcomes and household air pollution exposure levels in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset of firms in several industries to estimate the effect of export promotion programs on firm-level export promotion results.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of firms"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on administrative data on social protection spending in multiple countries, supplemented with a dataset on social protection beneficiaries.", "dataset": ["administrative data on social protection spending", "dataset on social protection beneficiaries"], "topic": ["Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the impact of climate change on agricultural production and farmers' livelihoods, we use a combination of remotely-sensed weather data from NASA and detailed household survey data collected by the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA).", "dataset": ["remotely-sensed weather data from NASA", "household survey data collected by the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data on electricity generation from the International Energy Agency (IEA), we model future global trends in renewable energy investment and carbon emissions.", "dataset": ["data on electricity generation from the International Energy Agency (IEA)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use a novel dataset on companies' sustainability performance, as well as publicly available financial data, to evaluate the impact of sustainable practices on firm profitability.", "dataset": ["dataset on companies' sustainability performance"], "topic": ["Social Sustainability and Inclusion", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines changes in access to finance for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) before and after the 2008 global financial crisis using two datasets: a cross-country dataset on bank lending, and a specific regional-level dataset on SME financing.", "dataset": ["cross-country dataset on bank lending", "specific regional-level dataset on SME financing"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from multiple countries, we investigate the impact of social protection programs on poverty and inequality outcomes in different contexts.", "dataset": ["household survey data from multiple countries"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "To identify the key drivers of deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon, we combine satellite imagery data with data on land concessions issued by the Brazilian government.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "data on land concessions issued by the Brazilian government"], "topic": ["Environment"]}]}

content: [{"sentence": "We use two datasets in this study: a dataset on electricity consumption for households and the World Bank's Development Indicators dataset.", "dataset": ["electricity consumption for households", "World Bank's Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Energy", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws on data from nationally-representative surveys conducted by the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) program to investigate the relationship between maternal health outcomes and household air pollution exposure levels in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset of firms in several industries to estimate the effect of export promotion programs on firm-level export promotion results.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of firms"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on administrative data on social protection spending in multiple countries, supplemented with a dataset on social protection beneficiaries.", "dataset": ["administrative data on social protection spending", "dataset on social protection beneficiaries"], "topic": ["Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the impact of climate change on agricultural production and farmers' livelihoods, we use a combination of remotely-sensed weather data from NASA and detailed household survey data collected by the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA).", "dataset": ["remotely-sensed weather data from NASA", "household survey data collected by the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data on electricity generation from the International Energy Agency (IEA), we model future global trends in renewable energy investment and carbon emissions.", "dataset": ["data on electricity generation from the International Energy Agency (IEA)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use a novel dataset on companies' sustainability performance, as well as publicly available financial data, to evaluate the impact of sustainable practices on firm profitability.", "dataset": ["dataset on companies' sustainability performance"], "topic": ["Social Sustainability and Inclusion", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines changes in access to finance for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) before and after the 2008 global financial crisis using two datasets: a cross-country dataset on bank lending, and a specific regional-level dataset on SME financing.", "dataset": ["cross-country dataset on bank lending", "specific regional-level dataset on SME financing"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from multiple countries, we investigate the impact of social protection programs on poverty and inequality outcomes in different contexts.", "dataset": ["household survey data from multiple countries"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "To identify the key drivers of deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon, we combine satellite imagery data with data on land concessions issued by the Brazilian government.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "data on land concessions issued by the Brazilian government"], "topic": ["Environment"]}]}
